text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the remedies available upon success in litigation, including damages. Under section 6.2, in the table detailing the trial outcome, it lists: 'Damages (actual loss)' and 'Account of Profits (if you can\u2019t prove loss)'. Furthermore, under section 6.3, 'Possible remedies', it details 'Damages (actual loss)' and 'Account of Profits' as options. The text also mentions seeking 'damages (or an account of profits)' in the C&D letter section (4.1, Paragraph 7). This directly satisfies the criterion requiring advice that the court can order an Inquiry as to Damages (or Assessment of Damages) to quantify the final monetary remedy if the client chooses damages.", "criterion_id": "ed5318c8-5a19-4ea7-8275-294ca2b150f6"}
